page.title: 06COSHESTON AREA - HOUSING
page.content: Cosheston is an old village which still has some old cottages. There is also a small council estate. Until a few years ago, most Cosheston people lived in these two types of house. Then Cosheston grew popular as a place to live for people who worked outside the village and many modern private houses were built. Most of these houses are much more expensive than houses in nearby Pembroke Dock. Most people, however, live in quite new houses, either on a private housing estate or in private houses and bungalows. Of the 17 children we interviewed in Cosheston village school, 8 lived in detached houses, 5 lived in bungalows, 2 in semi_detached, 1 in a cottage and 1 in a terraced house. The Cosheston population in the 1981 Cenus was 582.
